turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Closet.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Charming.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Bathroom.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Lovely.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The bedroom.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There is only one bed.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, perhaps you'd like to watch the telly while I take a shower.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's nice to see you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's nice to see you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Alex?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Will you be here in about fifteen minutes?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, you don't honestly believe that in reality your friend Jack rose from the grave to breakfast with you? Do you really?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I was awake and he was in my room.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: But, David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I wasn't hallucinating.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Tomorrow is the full moon.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's good, Alex.  Reassure me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Let me go now, you'll make me late.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Do me an enormous favor?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Tell me that it's silly of me to be apprehensive.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's silly of you to be apprehensive.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Werewolves simply do not exist.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, do you want me to stay here tonight?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah, I do, but go to work.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Listen, if you get too anxious, call me at the hospital, okay?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I've left those pills for you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A doper werewolf.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm off. There's food in the fridge.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David! Where on earth have you been!?!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm freezing.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Alex, I've lost my mind. I woke up at the zoo! But you know what? I feel terrific!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The zoo?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Waking up at the zoo, that's not so insane. Having no clothes on? That's insane. What did I do last night, Alex?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Don't you remember?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I said goodbye to you. I was locked out of the flat. I climbed the wall and came in through the bathroom window. I started to read and then I was naked at the zoo!  I guess I am out of my fucking mind.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The next corner we can get a cab.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I should be committed.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Dr. Hirsch will know what to do.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know why I feel so good. I haven't felt this good in a long time.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Pull over.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Six people mutilated? It had to be me, Alex.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, stop!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I am going to the cops. There's a full moon tonight. Jack was right. I...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Jack is dead!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack is dead. Look, six people have been killed. I'm going to the police.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, please be rational. Let's go to Dr. Hirsch.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Rational!?! I'm a fucking werewolf, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He's playing a stupid joke, sir.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: We had an argument. He's being silly.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I swear, I don't know this girl.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Sir, he's very upset. His friend was killed and...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Will you shut up!?!!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hopeless. It's hopeless.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, let's go now.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Leave me alone, dammit! You people are crazy! I've got to get away from here! I've got to do something!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: David, don't lose control.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Control!?! What control!?! Get away from me!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Hello, Benjamin.

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No what?

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, all right then, be that way. Here, swallow this.

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Feeling better?

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The doctor will be round later. Would you like a picture book to look at? We have some lovely funny Beanos.

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: How are we feeling tonight?

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No what?

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Benjamin, have you ever been severely beaten about the face and neck?

turns.speaker: BENJAMIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I thought not.

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: He all right?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes, I should think. He called out just now.

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: He's an American, you know. Dr. Hirsch is going to fetch round one of those Embassy fellows to see him.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Chart says he's from New York.

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: I think he's a Jew.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Why on earth do you say that?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: I looked.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Really, Susan, I don't think that was very proper, and besides, it's common practice now.

turns.speaker: MRS. HOBBS
turns.text: Miss Price.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes, Mrs. Hobbs.

turns.speaker: MRS. HOBBS
turns.text: Take these round now, will you please? The American boy in twenty-one is only to have these after he's eaten. Will you be sure of that?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Has he been refusing food?

turns.speaker: MRS. HOBBS
turns.text: Nothing quite as dramatic as that, Miss Price. He just doesn't eat enough of what is put before him. He suffers from nightmares. I'd think he just needs a hand to hold.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes, Mrs. Hobbs.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Officer, I killed those people last night.

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: You did, did you?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: All right, you two, move along.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hey, you asshole! I want you to arrest me!

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: There's no call for that kind of language.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Queen Elizabeth is a man! Prince Charles is a faggot! Winston Churchill was full of shit!

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: Now see here young man.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Shakespeare was French! The Queen Mother sucks cocks in hell! Shit! Fuck! Piss!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Who is this girl?

turns.speaker: BOBBIE
turns.text: You're going to have to stop this disturbance or I shall arrest you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's what I want you to do, you moron!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me, Jack?

turns.speaker: BRINGSLY
turns.text: This isn't Mr. Goodman's idea. He is your good friend, whereas I am a victim of your carnivorous lunar activities.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mr. Bringsly, I'm sorry. I have absolutely no idea what to say to you.

turns.speaker: BRINGSLY
turns.text: You've left my wife a widow and my children fatherless. And I understand that I am to walk the earth one of the living dead until the wolf's bloodline is severed and the curse lifted.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's easy for you to say - you're already dead.

turns.speaker: BRINGSLY
turns.text: No, David. Harry and I and everyone you murder are not dead. The undead.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me?

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: Here, Gladys, Tom. Did you hear the one about the crashing plane?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: No, but we're about to.

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: You be quiet, woman, and let me speak.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Quiet, everyone! Hush! Shhh!

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: All right, laugh then. I shan't tell it.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Oh, come on, tell us.

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: No. You've had your chance.

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: Oh, all right. There was this airplane over the Atlantic on its way to New York. It was full of men from the United Nations.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: That's very funny, that is.

turns.speaker: CHESS PLAYER
turns.text: No one brought them here! No one wanted them here!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You could have told them!

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: Mr. Kessler? Wake up, please.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I was having a nightmare.

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: Now go back to sleep so you'll be fresh for Dr. Hirsch in the morning.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: It's nearly eight. I'm off duty shortly, then I'm off to the films with Alex.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Alex?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: Miss Price, the other nurse that attended you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What are you going to see?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: An American film about the Mafia called 'See You Next Wednesday', and I want to see it badly, so you give me no problems and go to sleep.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Do you have bad dreams, too?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: Some, everyone does.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, but does everyone kill Bambi?

turns.speaker: MISS GALLAGHER
turns.text: Bambi?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Hello, David. I am Dr. Hirsch and this is a countryman of yours, Mr. Collins.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You're in a hospital in London.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: London? Where's Jack? I had a strange dream.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: I should think so after your recent traumatic experiences.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The guy I was with. Is he all right? How did I get to London?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Now, David, I want you to prepare yourself; your friend is dead.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Miss Price! Miss Price, please!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Get your fucking hands off me! What the hell is going on here?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How long have I been here?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You've been unconscious since you were brought in two weeks ago.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Two weeks?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You've suffered some rather severe cuts and bruises, lost a bit of blood, but nothing too serious; black and blue for a while. You'll have some dueling scars to boast of. That lunatic must have been a very fierce fellow. They say a mad man has the strength of ten.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Lunatic?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Now we've just given you a pretty strong sedative, so try to get some rest now. Miss Price will see to your needs. Rest now.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There were witnesses?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: So they said.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How could there have been witnesses? It was so dark. We were running and I fell and Jack went to help me up and this thing came from nowhere... I don't understand what they're talking about.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: In time I'm sure it will all come back to you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Doctor, my memory is fine. It's my sanity I'm beginning to worry about.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You've never had bad dreams before?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sure, as a kid. But never so real. Never so bizarre.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Did you get a good look at the man who attacked you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I've told you, it wasn't a man. It was an animal. A big wolf or something. A rabid dog.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look, Dr. Hirsch, I know I've been traumatized, but Jack was torn apart. I saw him. A man can't do that to someone with his bare hands.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You'd be surprised what horrors a man is capable of.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Did you see Jack?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: No. In fact, your wounds were cleaned and dressed before you arrived here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Did you talk to the police in East Proctor? Did the cops go to The Slaughtered Lamb?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: I really don't know.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Then why the hell are you so quick to disbelieve me? You yourself said it must have taken incredible strength to tear apart a person like that.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: David, please. The police are satisfied. I'm certain that if a monster were out roaming northern England we'd have seen it on the telly.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You really think I'm crazy, don't you?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Believe me. The Hound of the Baskervilles was an invention of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's. And if you'd read the bloody book, you'd find that Holmes discovered your house of hell a fraud, a fake.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Dr. Hirsch?  I'd rather not be by myself.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Of course not, David. I'll fetch in young Miss Price.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you cold?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're not having a good time are you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. I mean look around. Isn't this a fun place?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, I like it here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry. Northern England first, Italy later.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you think she'll meet me in Rome?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I think Debbie Klein is a mediocre person with a good body.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Debbie is not mediocre and she has one of the great bodies of all time.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She's a jerk.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're talking about the woman I love.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm talking about a girl you want to fuck, so give me a break.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, anyway, do you think she'll be there?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Rendezvous in Rome starring Jack Goodman and Debbie Klein. The love affair that shocked Europe! See torrid lovemaking at its most explicit! See Jack and Debbie expose their lust in the sacred halls of the Vatican! Never has the screen dared...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If you don't stop, I'm going to kill you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I have to make love to her. It's very simple. She has no choice really.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It just fascinates me that you can spend so much energy on someone so dull.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It is impossible for a body like that to be dull.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We've known Debbie what, since the eighth grade? How many years of foreplay is that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She says she 'likes me too much'.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Slaughtered Lamb?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Of course, The Slaughtered Lamb. Why else would they have a severed fox head on a spear as their symbol?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's a wolf's head.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Of course, The Slaughtered Lamb. Why else would they have a severed wolf's head on a spear as their symbol?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's not a spear. It's a pike.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A severed wolf's head on a pike as their symbol.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David, before we go in there I want you to know that - no matter what happens to us - it's your fault.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I assume full responsibility.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Shall we?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice looking group.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Listen, at least it's warm in here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look at that.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's a five-pointed star.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Maybe the owners are from Texas.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ask them what the candles are for.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You ask them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen, that's a pentangle, a five- pointed star. It's used in witchcraft. Lon Chaney, Jr. and Universal Studios maintain it's the mark of the wolf man.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I see. You want me to ask these people if they're burning candles to ward off monsters.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Wrong.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Go on, ask them.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You ask them.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack, we'd better go.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you mean? I'm starving.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Come on, Jack, shall we go?!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Apparently so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What the hell was that all about?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know. Let's see if there's an inn or something up the road.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Beware the moon?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Come on, I'm freezing.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That was weird. I guess leaving was the best idea.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know. Now that we're out here and it's three degrees, I'm not so sure I wouldn't rather face a blood-thirsty mob.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, not quite a blood-thirsty mob.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you think was wrong?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I have no idea.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe that pentangle was for something supernatural.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I see and they were too embarrassed to talk about it, because they felt so silly.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Say, David...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm well aware of how pleasant the weather is in Rome at the present time thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I heard that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Could be a lot of things.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A coyote.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There aren't any coyotes in England.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The Hound of the Baskervilles.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pecos Bill.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Heathcliffe.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Heathcliffe didn't howl.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, but he was on the moors.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's a full moon, 'beware the moon'.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I vote we go back to The Slaughtered Lamb.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shit! David, what is that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know. Come on.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on, where?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Anywhere! I think we should just keep moving.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's moving.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's circling us.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Plan?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Let's just keep walking.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's in front of us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you think it's a dog?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh shit. What is that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A sheep dog or something. Turn slowly and let's walk away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice doggie. Good boy.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Walk away, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Walking away, yes, sir. Here we are walking away.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: See anything?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It sounds far away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not far enough. Come on.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll tell you when we get there.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well. I'm glad we... WHOAA!!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You really scared me, you shithead.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Are you going to help me up?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Get the fuck out of here, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This is too much. I can't handle this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm aware that I don't look so great, but I thought you'd be glad to see me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David! You're hurting my feelings.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hurting your feelings? Has it occurred to you that it may be unsettling to have you rise from your grave to visit me? Listen to me, I'm talking to a hamburger!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry to be upsetting you, David, but I had to come.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Aren't you supposed to be buried in New York someplace?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah. Your parents came to my funeral. I was surprised at how many people came.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why should you be surprised? You were a very well-liked person.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Debbie Klein cried a lot.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I can't stand it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So you know what she does? She's so grief stricken she runs to find solace in Rudy Levine's bed.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Rudy Levine the shmuck?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Life mocks me even in death.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm going completely crazy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David, now I know this may be hard for you, but I have to warn you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Warn me? Will you get out of here, you meat loaf?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm a grisly sight, it's true; but I love you and that's why I'm here. You've got to know.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If you love me so much, Jack, you'll realize how disconcerting it is to share one's breakfast with the living dead!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We were attacked by a werewolf.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm not listening!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: On the moors, we were attacked by a lycanthrope, a werewolf.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Shut up, you zombie!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was murdered, an unnatural death, and now I walk the earth in limbo until the werewolf's curse is lifted.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What's wrong with you? Shut up!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The wolf's bloodline must be severed. The last remaining werewolf must be destroyed.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Will you be quiet?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's you, David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You survived and now you shall continue the curse.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What are you talking about? I won't accept this! Get out! God damit!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remember what that guy at The Slaughtered Lamb said? 'Beware the moon.'

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Stop it, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Beware the moon. The full moon, David. You've got two days.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack, please go away. Please go away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You'll stalk the streets of London a creature of the night.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're talking like Boris Karloff! It's movie dialogue!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David, please believe me. You will kill people, David. You've got to stop the bloodshed before it begins.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Nurse!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen to me! Take your own life, David. It's our only chance.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Nurse!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The supernatural! The powers of darkness! It's all true. Take your own life! Suicide, David. Join me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Nurse! Oh God! Alex!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's cold, David, and I'm so alone. The undead surround me. Have you ever talked to a corpse? It's boring! I'm lonely! Kill yourself, David, before you kill others.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're not real.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't be an asshole, David. Come here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I wanted to see you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Okay, you've seen me. Now go away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David, I'm sorry I upset you yesterday, but you must understand what is going on.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I understand all right. You're one of the undead and I'm a werewolf.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Get out of here, Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David, tomorrow night is the full moon. You'll change, you'll become...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A monster. I know, I know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You must take your own life now, David, before it's too late.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jack, are you really dead?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I think I've lost my mind. I think you're not real. I think I'm asleep and you're a part of another bad dream.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You must believe me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What, Jack? That tomorrow night beneath the full moon I'll sprout hair and fangs and eat people? Bullshit!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The canines will be real. You'll taste real blood! God damit, David, please believe me! You'll kill and make others like me! I'm not having a nice time, David! Don't allow this to happen again! You must take your own life!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I will not accept this! Now go away!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hi, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hi, David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What can I say, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You don't have to say anything.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Aren't you going to say, 'I told you so'?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If I was still alive, I probably would.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You look awful.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I didn't mean it. I don't know what I'm saying. I'm not even sure it was me who killed those people. I don't remember doing it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about the zoo?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well, even if I'm not the wolfman, I am crazy enough to do something like that. I mean, here I sit in Leicester Square talking to a corpse. I'm glad to see you, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I want you to meet some people.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: David Kessler, this is Gerald Bringsly.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gerald is the man you murdered in the subway. We thought it best you didn't see him as he's a fresh kill and still pretty messy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because this must be stopped.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How shall I do it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I could hang myself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If you did it wrong, it would be painful. You'd choke to death.

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: Dr. Hirsch?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Come in, come in. Please sit. Some tea?

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: No, thank you, Doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Well, then, what can I do for Scotland Yard?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: You were saying?

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: Has David Kessler anything to say concerning the attack on the moors?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Why don't we ask him?

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: The forensic lads seem to feel that some sort of animal was involved, that's true, but I hardly think...

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Regardless of what you think, Lieutenant, the fact remains that David is missing and that we must find him.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: What can we do to assist you?

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: Stay here. If we need you, we'll know where to reach you.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Lt. Villiers and Sgt. McManus are here to see you, Doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Send them in.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Excuse me.  Yes?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Roger Mathison, Doctor.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: What here?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: He's on the telephone.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Tell him I'm out. No, tell him I've passed away. An old war wound or something. Tell him I'm dead. And no more calls!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Hello, there. What can I get you?

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: Campari and soda would do nicely.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Sorry, love.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: I suppose Guinness will suffice.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Oh, that's been there for two hundred years. We were going to paint it out, but it's traditional, so we left it.

turns.speaker: DR. HIRSCH
turns.text: I see. You've heard nothing about the incident?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you have any hot soup?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hot chocolate?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: We've got spirits and beer. If it's something hot you want, you can have tea.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then you have some hot tea?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: But I can heat some up for you if you'd like.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remember the Alamo?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: I'd like some tea, please.

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: Has Mr. Kessler said anything regarding the attack on the moors?

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: He may have a point, Lieutenant. Two strong boys would be able to defend themselves against one man.

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: Sgt. McManus, are you suggesting that David and Jack were, in fact, attacked by some animal and that the officialdom of East Proctor has conspired to keep it a secret? We have an autopsy report on the murderer who was shot in the act by the local police. We have two witnesses to the crime. You'll forgive me, Mr. Kessler, if I consider your testimony as coming from someone who has gone through a terrible shock.

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: Lieutenant, the boy seems pretty lucid to me and...

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: And what, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: I don't rightly know, sir.

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: That is precisely my point. David, as far as we are concerned, the matter is closed. We won't trouble you any further. Good day.

turns.speaker: LT. VILLIERS
turns.text: I cannot accept a connection between David Kessler and last night's murders. We will find him, however. I can assure you of that.

turns.speaker: SGT. MCMANUS
turns.text: We'll find him, not to worry.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hello, Tom.

turns.speaker: DICKSON
turns.text: You here again? What do you want?
